bundle.name: vpn

description.p: The OpenVPN bundle is used to secure public connections between computers. If you have a secure LAN then you do not need to install OpenVPN at all. (i.e. a secure LAN is a LAN that only your computers have access to.)
The OpenVPN creates a network of computers to communicate through a safe, encrypted tunnel (Server Side) rendering a public LAN secure.

An OpenVPN server is used to setup a computer that allows connections and accepts connections. Servers are a bottle neck, however, you can install the server multiple times and in effect make it work in a failsafe manner.

field.name: server_address
field.label: VPN Server IP address
field.description: The server IP address to which the cleint will connect.

field.name: organization_unit
field.label: Organization Unit
field.description: The unit of your organization responsible for your servers.

field.name: country
field.label: Country
field.description: Two letter abbrieviation for the name of your country (e.g. 'US' stands for 'United States').

field.name: clients
field.label: Client Name List
field.description: Enter one client per line. This name should also resolve to the IP address of the client in question.

bundle.postinst:
# Clear out the easy-rsa dist just in case cd /etc/openvpn rm -rf *.crt *.key *.conf *.ovpn easy-rsa
# get the default RSA key data cp -r /usr/share/easy-rsa .
# Generate the Diffie-Hellman parameters DH2048=/etc/openvpn/dh2048.pem if [ ! -f ${DH2048} ] then openssl dhparam -out ${DH2048} 2048 fi
# Create server.conf file gunzip -c /usr/share/doc/openvpn/examples/sample-config-files/server.conf.gz | \ sed \ -e "s/dh1024.pem/dh2048.pem/" \ -e "s/;user nobody/user nobody/" \ -e "s/;group nogroup/group nogroup/" \ > /etc/openvpn/server.conf
# Setup the keys as defined by the user in the installation form sed \ -e "s/KEY_ORG=\".*\"/KEY_ORG=\"${BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_ORGANIZATION}\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_OU=\".*\"/KEY_OU=\"${BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_ORGANIZATION_UNIT}\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_CITY=\".*\"/KEY_CITY=\"${BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_CITY}\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_PROVINCE=\".*\"/KEY_PROVINCE=\"${BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_PROVINCE}\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_COUNTRY=\".*\"/KEY_COUNTRY=\"${BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_COUNTRY}\"/" \ -e "s/KEY_EMAIL=\".*\"/KEY_EMAIL=\"${BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_EMAIL}\"/" \ /usr/share/easy-rsa/vars > /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa/vars
# Now create the RSA CA key cd /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa . ./vars ./clean-all ./pkitool --initca
# Now create the server key and copy it in ./pkitool --server server cp /etc/openvpn/easy-rsa/keys/{server.crt,server.key,ca.crt} /etc/openvpn/
parse_list() { local IFS="\n" set -f arr=( $@ ) set +f }
unset arr parse_list( ${BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_CLIENTS} ) for client in "${arr[@]]}" do local keys_dir=/etc/openvpn/easy-rsa/keys local client_file="${keys_dir}/${client}.ovpn" ./pkitool --initca ${client} sed \ -e "s/^;user nobody/user nobody/" \ -e "s/^;group nogroup/group nogroup/" \ -e "s/^remote my-server-1 1194/remote ${BUNDLE_INSTALLATION_SERVER_ADDRESS} 1194/" \ -e "s/^cert client.crt/cert ${client}.crt/" \ -e "s/^key client.key/key ${client}.key/" \ -e "s/^ca ca.crt/#ca ca.crt/" \ -e "s/^cert server.crt/#cert server.crt/" \ -e "s/^key server.key/#key server.key/" \ /usr/share/doc/openvpn/examples/sample-config-files/client.conf \ > ${client_file} append_file() { echo ">${1}<" << ${client_file} cat ${keys_dir}/${2} << ${client_file} echo ">/${1}<\n" << ${client_file} } append_file( "ca" "ca.crt" ) append_file( "key" "${client}.key" ) append_file( "crt" "${client}.crt" ) done
# Start the server systemctl start openvpn@server
